: ... the first day, I met Luna almost immediately, and she saved my life then. We were singing together when our entry fees were taken. After that, she sang alone, but it was beautiful and... music still ​existed​ in the world, so everything would be okay. She was happy. I was happy. Neither of us actually were, but we were magical girls together anyway, and destroyed a police car after she remembered one killing her. She told me about her brother and I told her I'd always protect her. We made a pact within the first few hours and we thought everything would be okay.
: You...destroyed a police car?
: Yep. We found one. And kicked it and beat it up until it broke. Mostly her, 'cause we found out I couldn't use my pins outside of battle.
: That's interesting..
: Tell me more.

: The second day, Kei-sama came down and talked to us himself, and the Game wasn't fun anymore. Luna was back at Ochre, where we were staying. I didn't have her with me, so it hurt more when Kei-sama described how this game was pitting all of us against each other, how the reapers were our enemies but we were enemies with all the other players too and in the end if we fought it meant our survival was the most important out of everyone's. I realised at least five people had to die. It was... scary. So scary. I'd been smiling since I woke up and Luna had been helping me because she always smiled too, and I thought if I stopped I'd never start again. Jessamyn noticed when I stopped-- when I was crying-- and she came over and hugged me and it felt like I was safe from all of the scary things, because in that moment it felt like everyone but her or Luna wasn't safe to be around, might want me dead. I called her senpai and I loved her. I still do. She promised she'd remember me forever, and... somehow, that made it seem okay, like even if I got erased someone would still ​remember.​

: ... I told Kei-sama he was wrong. That the game didn't pit every single person against each other, because we had ​partners​ and we had to care about them, and he patted me on the head and said I'd unlocked another piece of the puzzle, as long as I didn't just value my partner as the key to my own survival. So I decided that no matter how scared I was or how much I wanted to give up, I had to keep fighting. Not for myself, but for Luna.
. . .

: Usa-san provided costumes, later, and Ri-chan led us in a cosplay dance performance of Love Live. I'm not really sure what led up to that. Truth or Dare, I think, but I was off talking to Mai-chan about why she killed herself and if I could still trust her, so only got to the end.
: Oh, and then I met a fox Noise! Its name was Peaches! I set it on fire a bunch but it was ​so cute!​
nervous sweatdrop.
: Freezing it could have preserved it.
: Maybe... but I think dealing ice damage to things erases them too.
: I remember seeing a couple ice pins...
takes out her Cold Stare.

: The third day, Fire-chan erased Aella-san. Mai-chan had hoped to be a reaper, but Kei-sama said he didn't want her, so Usa-san held her in the middle of a group hug and assured her she'd be part of the city. I didn't know what it meant then, and she was my friend, so I cried again and promised Luna we'd be together forever. We had to keep going, though. Later that day, Iris-san erased Yuuna-san. Shion-san told us we all had to keep going... very encouraging.
: Day four?
: Important things happened on day three, though... I'm getting to them!

: ... we had a group hug going and were laughing and cheerful and in the middle of friendship. Then... I sat with a few others and watched helplessly as Iro-chan dragged Sef-san off for a solo battle. They pitted him against a fox Noise, but the fox took on the form of his best friend, a boy who'd died a few years back or disappeared or something. I think, anyway. Sef-san couldn't bring himself to attack the disguised fox, but his psyches activated autonomously to kill it just before he died. Several minutes into Sef-san's fight, Ruki-chan an' Nagi-chan cornered Ri-chan-- Sef-san's partner!-- and asked her if she wanted to play a game. She was really smiley and happy and loved everyone, so of course she did.
: I still remember the exact inflection in Ruki-chan's voice when he told her he wanted to break her.
: She didn't break. Sef-san did, he broke, he was practically catatonic, but she never did, even when she was so close to dying.

: She was still smiling as we were watching and begging someone to interfere because even Nagi-chan wanted to stop and it wasn't a clean erasure, it wasn't ​right.​ Usa-san phased in and took what would've been the fatal blow, then took Ri-chan home.

: On the fourth day, Jess-senpai was sad because no one wanted to take her offer. 'Option D'-- a way to get out of the Game freely, without being erased, becoming a reaper, or... I forget the third possibility.
: ... Sef-san took her offer.

: She said a player's partner is what binds them to the UG and she couldn't do anything while they were both bound... so while she hated to ask this of them, could he and Ri-chan be dears and erase one of themselves?

: Sef-san dragged Ri-chan into the Noise plane and fought her. He yelled at her and tried to get her to shut up, but... she said games weren't as fun if they couldn't talk... insisted they were best friends...
: In the end, he couldn't erase her.
: But she never ever realised they weren't just playing, so erased him instead.

: She had seven minutes. She was hugging Jess-senpai and Jess-senpai was promising they'd play together forever, but then all the lights went out and there was screaming and four minutes after Sef-san's erasure the lights came back on and Ri-chan was gone and senpai was sobbing.
: ... I believed in senpai. That she'd never hurt me or Ri-chan. Anyone else, maybe... but she loved us. I believed that with all my heart.
: Others didn't, maybe. I don't know if they did or didn't back then. I wasn't listening. The mission was to hunt down whatever killed Ri-chan and erase it and that's what we did.
: ... the Noise that killed her looked a lot like senpai's Noise form, but I didn't know it then.

: By the time almost everyone was gone, Iro-chan brought musical equipment out and played an impromptu concert for me and Kafu-san to listen in on and do our best to join in. Afterwards, they said I could borrow a guitar-- the guitar I'm holding, actually-- for the rest of the week, so that I'd still be able to make music, even if I couldn't sing. They called me Sango, the colour of coral, and I told them they must never lose hope no matter what-- 'cause they hadn't been doing really well earlier this week, you see? And hope is such a very, very important thing! We were friends, then, and promised we could text each other if anything was wrong.
: The fifth day we met Airi Koizumi and she told us we were terrible at Reaper Creeper and it was true.
: Then she told us about senpai being a yandere and how she'd killed her and Naoki and I didn't want to believe it was true but senpai wouldn't explain otherwise.

Midway through the fight, he growled out something about not being able to care, and-- he'd cared about Sef-san, an' Ri-chan, an' I knew it because I watched him when I told him the news of their erasure. We set him on fire a lot and he wouldn't tell us if he was going to be erased if we won and I hugged him, then burnt him to death while doing so because I hated him more than I had ever hated anyone and my pin remembered.

Ruki-chan asked if he could borrow me, and I said yes, so he threw me into the Noise plane and tried to murder me, except he couldn't, so he broke down and we had a feelings jam instead and now we're friends.
